articles.title: North, South Should Improve Relations on Basis of Results of Urgent Contact: Kim Yang Gon
articles.content:
North, South Should Improve Relations on Basis of Results of Urgent Contact: Kim Yang Gon
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yang Gon, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, gave the following answers to questions raised by KCNA Thursday as regards the recent north-south high-level urgent contact:
					 As was already reported, the north and the south held a high-level urgent contact at Panmunjom from August 22 to 24 and had a wide-ranging discussion on various issues of putting under control the recently created grave situation and improving the north-south relations and made public a joint press release on the basis of its results.
					
					 The joint press release reflected the will and stand of both sides to prevent armed conflicts, de-escalate tensions and promote the development of the bilateral relations.
					
					 It was very fortunate that the recent contact helped defuse the danger of the touch-and-go situation that may plunge not only the Korean peninsula but the whole of Northeast Asia into the whirlpool of an upheaval and offered an opportunity of a dramatic turn in achieving peace, stability, reconciliation and cooperation between the north and the south.
					
					 We are pleased over the fact that the north and the south sat face to face, sympathized with the danger of the situation and had an exhaustive discussion to reach an agreement on issues of common concern, thus opening up an epochal phase for turning misfortune into blessings in the north-south relations.
					
					 The public at home and abroad are unanimously welcoming the north and the south for preventing the situation from plunging into an unpredictable conflict and joining hands for reconciliation.
					
					 The north and the south should value the spirit of the agreement reached at the contact and not just feel complacent at tiding over the extreme crisis but advance the north-south relations in the constructive direction for reunification.
					
					 It is my view that the contact would not have considerable meaning if it just ends up as a stop-gap measure.
					
					 Both sides should wipe out mistrust and confrontation and opt for mending the bilateral relations from a bold stand through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 As was agreed in the joint press release, the north and the south should resolve issues of common concern through dialogue and negotiations between the authorities and reenergize broad exchanges and cooperation in various fields.
					
					 To this end, it is of priority importance to keep afloat and develop the present trend of situation in which the north and the south put on the track of detente with much effort.
					
					 The north and the south should never allow such happening which makes them get inveigled in a disturbing situation for uncertain reasons, leading the situation to an extreme phase.
					
					 In fact, the north and the south should not have been embroiled in such abnormal case as the recent one.
					
					 Both sides should learn a lesson from the recent case, should not lose reason and temper when complicated problems arise in the inter-Korean relations but make efforts to prevent the recurrence of such incident.
					
					 The north and the south should no longer be bound to the past but care about the future of the nation first and look far into the future and join hands for repairing the relations and achieving reunification.
					
					 There can be forces unwilling for the rapid development of the north-south relations. So, we should be vigilant against them.
					
					 From this viewpoint, the north and the south should pay particular attention to preventing any unexpected incident from happening and firmly maintain the idea of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 Consistent is the stand of the DPRK to bring about a great change and surge in the north-south relations and open up a wide avenue to independent reunification this significant year of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					 We will make positive efforts to improve the north-south relations as desired by all the Koreans in the spirit agreed upon at the recent north-south high-level urgent contact.

articles.title: State Commendations Awarded to Exemplary Officials, Young People
articles.content:
State Commendations Awarded to Exemplary Officials, Young People
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- State commendations were awarded to officials and members of shock brigades and young front-rankers in noble traits who performed labor feats in the project for reconstructing and repairing railways in the northern part of the country.
					 Awarding ceremonies took place in different parts of the country.
					
					 According to decrees of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, a wrist watch bearing the august name of President Kim Il Sung was conferred upon Rim Thae Sim and citations of supreme leader Kim Jong Un upon Kim Song Nam, Cha Myong Chol, Jong Song Bok, Pak Song Hun, Ri Sun Chol and Kim Chol Su.
					
					 Kim Il Sung Youth Honor Prize  went to Ri Kum Chol, Kim Yong Nam, Kim Sun Il, Jo Hyok Chol, Kim Chang Ho, Kim Jun Chol, An Kyong Hui, Kim Kyong Ae, Kwon Sun Nam, O Hye Sim, Ri Jong Chol, Kim Kye Sung and Choe Yong Sim, Kim Jong Il Youth Honor Prize to Choe Song Gon, Han Ung, Jon Song Chol, Ri Hyon Min, Kim Song Hyon, Kim Su Jong, Ju Chun Song, Song Yun Hui, Han Hyon Ok, Ri Un Byol, Ri Kyong Sim, Kim Kwang Il and O Chol Jin.
					
					 The Order of National Flag First Class was awarded to 10 persons, Order of Labour to 3, Order of National Flag Second Class to 166, Order of National Flag Third Class to 362 and Medal of Merit to 786.
					
					 Honor Medal for Service in the Speed Campaign Youth Shock Brigade was awarded to 3 284 officers and members of the Speed Campaign Youth Shock Brigade and the August 28 Youth Shock Brigade.

articles.title: Congratulations to Thai FM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Thai FM
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong on Aug. 22 sent a congratulatory message to Don Pramudwinai upon his appointment as foreign minister of Thailand.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries that have entered the new stage of development would grow stronger and wished him success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Vietnamese Ambassador Gives Reception
articles.content:
Vietnamese Ambassador Gives Reception
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Vietnamese Ambassador to the DPRK Pham Viet Hung gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Thursday on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.
					 Present there on invitation were Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong and officials concerned including Pak Kun Gwang, Kim Hyong Ryong and Ri Kil Song, foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Vietnamese Delegation
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift by the visiting delegation of the Vietnamese Ministry of Public Security.
					 The gift was handed over to an official concerned on Thursday by head of the delegation Nguyen Kim Quy, vice director general of the General Bureau of Security of the ministry.

articles.title: Int'l Symposium Promotes Cooperation
articles.content:
Int'l Symposium Promotes Cooperation
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The International Symposium-2015 of Kim Il Sung University took place at the university on August 25-26, under the theme of "Scientific development and building of highly civilized nation".
					 Exchanged there were successes and experience gained in the fields of mathematics and medical, life and agricultural sciences.
					
					 The symposium laid foundations for further promoting academic exchanges among universities and scholars of various countries.
					
					 Thae Hyong Chol, president of Kim Il Sung University and minister of Higher Education, told KCNA that the symposium would be effective in turning countries more highly civilized.
					
					 Vice-President Ri Kuk Chol hoped that universities of various countries would further strengthen exchanges and cooperation with his university.
					
					 Prof. Stephan Langerman of Universite Libre de Bruxelles of Belgium said that a workshop on mathematics, as part of the symposium, marked a very important occasion in promoting cooperation, and expressed the willingness to continue attending the symposium in the future.

articles.title: National Ideological and Theoretical Seminar Held
articles.content:
National Ideological and Theoretical Seminar Held
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- A national seminar on the idea and theory of "Power of Youth" and "Songun Youth Culture", the new historical terms advanced by Marshal Kim Jong Un, took place at the Central Youth Hall on August 26.
					 The seminar heard papers clearly explaining and proving the idea and theory of the historical terms and indicating ways to thoroughly embody them.
					
					 Sin Kwang Chol, vice-rector of Kumsong University of Politics, said the history of the power of the youth would be given steady continuity and victory and glory would always be in store for the Korean youth as long as the idea of attaching importance to youth is considered as a strategic line of the Workers' Party of Korea and the revolution.
					
					 O Hye Son, director and editor-in-chief of the Kumsong Youth Publishing House, said the culture of the youth in the Songun era is, both in name and reality, a fruition of the extraordinary philosophical thinking and discovery of Marshal Kim Jong Un who is making a glorious history of building a power of the youth, true to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il's idea of attaching importance to the youth.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, underlined the need for the youth league organizations to conduct the work for ideological education in a vigorous, unique and offensive manner in order to train all the young people to be the ones with the strongest mental power who are firmly equipped with the revolutionary spirit of Paektu and the spirit of the blizzards of Paektu and possessed of noble political and ideological traits.
					
					 Kim Jin Ha, secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, called on all party organizations to intensify their guidance over the work of the youth league in every way as required by the WPK's idea of attaching importance to the youth and thus help demonstrate the might of the power of the youth.
					
					 The speakers called on youth league organizations, officials and youth to resolutely defend and preserve the exploits the President and Kim Jong Il performed by leading the youth movement, add eternal glory to them, more strikingly demonstrate the might of the power of the youth and thus accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche started in Mt. Paektu under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Present there were officials of ministries, national institutions, the youth league, those in the fields of science, education and media, teachers, researchers, journalists and editors.

articles.title: New Industrial Robots Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Industrial Robots Developed in DPRK
Pyongyang August 27 (KCNA) -- The Control Machine Institute under the DPRK State Academy of Sciences has developed new-type industrial robots.
					 According to Kim Song Chon, a room chief of the Institute, those industrial robots are needed for various economic sectors, especially sector requiring much labor under unfavorable conditions.
					
					 The newly-developed robots make it possible to raise the productivity twice with less manpower.

articles.title: DPRK Football Team Beats Its Chinese Rival 2:0
articles.content:
DPRK Football Team Beats Its Chinese Rival 2:0
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The DPRK football team beat its Chinese rival 2:0 in the semi-finals of the Under-19 Asian Football Confederation Women's Championship.
					 Ri Un Sim and Ri Kyong Hyang scored goals at the 30th and 61st minutes respectively.

articles.title: Art Exhibition "Blizzards of Paektu" Opens
articles.content:
Art Exhibition "Blizzards of Paektu" Opens
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- An art exhibition "Blizzards of Paektu" was opened here on Thursday.
					 Displayed in the center of the venue of the exhibition is an art work depicting leader Kim Jong Il standing atop Mt. Paektu despite blizzards.
					
					 Displayed in the venue are art works truthfully depicting the majestic appearance of Mt. Paektu and paintings of study.
					
					 Oil painting "Snowstorm of the Paektu Tableland", "Blizzards of Janggun Peak", "Snowstorm of Mt. Paektu" and other works harden the revolutionary faith of the army and people of the DPRK and indicate a way of winning the final victory. They help visitors renew their resolution and will to make revolution.
					
					 Korean paintings "Holy Land of Paektu" and "Battle Theatre of Revolution", acryl paintings "Mt. Paektu in Morning " and "Janggun Peak at Sunrise" and other works make truthful depiction of the grand appearance of Mt. Paektu as the ancestral mountain and holy mountain of the revolution.
					
					 Korean painting "Sentry on Paektu" and oil painting "We Will Go to Mt. Paektu" reflected the steadfast faith and will of the service personnel to devotedly defend Marshal Kim Jong Un with arms and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche started in Mt. Paektu, true to his Songun leadership.

articles.title: Sci-Tech Presentation in Field of Fisheries and Fish Farming Held
articles.content:
Sci-Tech Presentation in Field of Fisheries and Fish Farming Held
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- A national scientific and technological presentation in the field of fisheries and fish farming took place at the Branch Academy of Fishery of the State Academy of Sciences on Wednesday and Thursday under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					 Present there were scientists, technicians, teachers, researchers and officials of various units including the Branch Academy of Fishery and the Bioengineering Branch of the State Academy of Sciences, Kim Il Sung University, Kim Hyong Jik University of Education, Wonsan University of Fisheries, South Phyongan, North Phyongan and South Hwanghae Provincial Fishery Management Bureaus.
					
					 The participants heard more than 80 valuable papers conducive to settling issues arising in fisheries and fish farming.
					
					 During the presentation there took place a lecture on technology on developing measuring instrument of water quality for fish farming and some issues arising in putting fish farming on a scientific and intensive basis.
					
					 At a closing ceremony on Thursday certificates were awarded to those who presented excellent papers.

articles.title: Japanese Militarists' Visit to Yasukuni Shrine Assailed
articles.content:
Japanese Militarists' Visit to Yasukuni Shrine Assailed
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The Japanese politicians paid a group visit to Yasukuni Shrine on August 15.
					 The visit is not just an internal issue of Japan but a sensitive political issue showing the Japanese government's stand and attitude to the history of past crimes, its stance on the abolition of those crimes and its future view on Asia, Rodong Sinmun says in a commentary Thursday.
					
					 It is quite natural that the international community expresses bitter indignation at the visit by the Japanese politicians and strongly demands a stop to it, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The attitude of the Japanese ruling quarters is shocking the people.
					
					 They, steeped in militarist idea to the marrow of their bones, are of the view and stand that there is no need to read others' face or consider others' feelings as for the visit to the shrine.
					
					 Every year the prime minister of the government sends funds for sacrificing offerings to the shrine and it has become a historical practice for the minister of Internal Affairs and the chairman for state security and other high-ranking officials of the government to visit the shrine.
					
					 Clear is what they seek through the visit.
					
					 They seek to rearm Japanese with aggression idea and realize at any cost the wild ambition for reinvasion.
					
					 For Japan launching reinvasion is as foolish an act as jumping into the abyss of self-destruction.
					
					 Just as the erstwhile fascist Japan drank a bitter cup, being hell-bent on aggression war while dreaming of becoming the "leader of the East", the present Japan dashing headlong into militarization while calling back the departed souls of "Yamato" will face the same future as was in the past.

articles.title: Japan Censured for Military Nexus with U.S.
articles.content:
Japan Censured for Military Nexus with U.S.
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Japan is rushing headlong into militarization and overseas expansion while getting hell-bent on rearmament with the U.S. support.
					 The Japan Defence Ministry clarified it would intensify information sharing with the U.S. Aegis warships in order to enhance the effect of a missile shield, according to Jiji Press Ltd of Japan.
					
					 It is mulling introducing this system to the new two Aegis warships of the Maritime "Self-Defense Force" to be built and put it into operation from 2020.
					
					 This means Japan's exercise of the "right to collective self-defence" and the "Self-Defense Forces'" sharing information for shielding U.S. warships from missiles.
					
					 The Japanese government already submitted to the Diet security bills for defending U.S. warships with the mission of transporting Japanese and monitoring missiles in waters off Japan, and the bills are now under discussion at the House of Councilors.
					
					 The Japan Defence minister also stressed the necessity of "sharing information between Japan and the U.S. for a missile shield."
					
					 All facts clearly prove that Japan-U.S. military nexus has reached a dangerous phase with an aim at militarist revival and reinvasion of the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Army and People of DPRK Confident of Victory: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Army and People of DPRK Confident of Victory: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Thursday in an article lashes out at the United States for staging the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military drills together with south Korea in areas very close to the DPRK. 
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. has become zealous in its ambition to swallow up the whole Korean peninsula at any cost and wipe out the DPRK on the map.
					
					 Mercilessly punishing aggressors and achieving the country's reunification are a solemn declaration of the army and people of the DPRK against the reckless moves of igniting a war.
					
					 It is the steadfast faith of the DPRK to settle accounts with the U.S. and satisfy the pent-up nation's grudge and build a reunified power to be seen by the world.
					
					 The Korean people's will of defending the country is mounting as much as their hatred against aggressors who make desperate efforts to violate this land.
					
					 The arms of the DPRK have never pardoned enemies who moved to hurt its dignity and social system.
					
					 The war provocation by the U.S.-led hostile forces is no more than the last-ditch efforts of those who are taken aback by the might of the DPRK which makes a leap forward and race against time, being convinced of the justness of its cause.
					
					 The DPRK's declaration that it would turn the base of aggression into the sea of fire and mercilessly wipe aggressors out to the last one is not an empty talk. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK who have built invincible power with steadfast revolutionary faith under the care of the brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu look far into the tomorrow of the victorious country.

articles.title: 70th Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked Abroad
articles.content:
70th Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked Abroad
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Foreign media carried special write-ups or aired a special program on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation. 
					 The Ugandan paper Sun Rise on August 14 dedicated one whole page to an article dealing with the historical significance of Korea's liberation, illustrated with a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 It said that Korea's liberation was the historic event in which the destiny of the Korean people dramatically changed from slaves to masters. The President enabled Korea, once eclipsed in the world map, to emerge a proud independent and sovereign state in the international arena, the article added. 
					
					 The British paper Workers Weekly on August 15 carried an article illustrated with a photo of the President making a historic address at a rally held to welcome him on his triumphant return home. It praised the role played by the DPRK to contribute to the world peace and security. 
					
					 The Senegalese paper Le Populaire on August 13 carried an article accompanied with a photo of Marshal Kim Jong Un. It said the DPRK founded by President Kim Il Sung is led by another brilliant commander of Songun Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army. He is recognized in the world political arena as the leader with the strongest courage and guts, it added. 
					
					 On the same day the Senegal State Radio in a program praised the personality of Kim Jong Un as a brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu as he carried forward the leadership art of the preceding leaders. 
					
					 The Guinean paper Horoya on August 12 dedicated one whole page to a special write-up illustrated with a photo of the Arch of Triumph. It said that August 15, 1945 was a turning point in the history of the Korean people.

articles.title: Day of Songun Marked in Guinea, Iran
articles.content:
Day of Songun Marked in Guinea, Iran
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Film shows were held in Guinea and Iran on August 18 and 19 on the occasion of the Day of Songun of the DPRK. 
					 Films shown include Korean films "Korean People's Army, Steel-Strong Ranks" and "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation". 
					
					 The commander of the First Commando of Almami Samori Toure Barracks of the Guinean Army said:
					
					 Thanks to the Songun leadership of H.E. Kim Jong Il, the DPRK has always won victories in the ceaseless confrontation with the U.S. styling itself "the world's only superpower". 
					
					 The U.S. escalated the tension on the Korean Peninsula through persistent military provocations such as the U.S. spy ship "Pueblo" incident and large-size spy plane "EC-121" incident. But each time it yielded to the resolute counteraction and tremendous military power of the DPRK. 
					
					 The DPRK's access to nuclear deterrent helped defuse the U.S. nuclear threat. 
					
					 A section chief of the Iranian IEI Company said that thanks to the Songun leadership of H.E. Kim Jong Il the DPRK turned into a political and military power. He hoped that the Korean people would achieve bigger successes in the building of a thriving nation under the leadership of respected H.E. Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Day of Songun Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
Day of Songun Observed in Different Countries
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- There took place a seminar in Kyrgyzstan, celebration meeting in Peru and photo exhibition and film shows in Nigeria from Aug. 18 to 21 on the occasion of the Day of Songun of the DPRK. 
					 On display at the venue of the photo exhibition were photos showing Songun leadership exploits of leader Kim Jong Il and others introducing achievements of the service personnel and people of the DPRK in the efforts to build a thriving nation. 
					
					 Korean films shown include "Masikryong Ski Resort". 
					
					 The chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party of Kyrgyzstan said Kim Jong Il put his heart and soul into turning the Korean People's Army into the matchless army fully prepared politically and ideologically and in military technique. 
					
					 The chairman of the Peruvian Association for the Study of Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Jong Suk said that Kim Jong Il turned the DPRK into a powerful country and a nuclear weapons state, which no formidable enemy dares provoke, by pursuing Songun politics.
					
					 The DPRK is shedding its rays all over the world under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, he added. 
					
					 The director of Farida General Hospital in Zamfara State, Nigeria said that Kim Jong Il provided a sure military guarantee for the victory of socialism with his Songun leadership. 
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar held in Kyrgyzstan.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Brazil
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Brazil
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Rosanita Campos, vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, contributed an article titled "The DPRK celebrates the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule" to the Brazilian paper Hora do Povo on Aug. 14.
					 He referred in detail to the exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung for liberating the country, saying that his exploits are brilliantly shining as he led the anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory, liberating the country and paving a new path for carving out the destiny of the Korean people.
					
					 He said that the DPRK is a powerful country as it produces itself everything necessary for improving the standard of the people's living and bolstering up its defence capability and had access to nuclear deterrent, in particular. 
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The DPRK has turned into a socialist paradise where all the people enjoy a happy life thanks to the socialist benefits including free education and free healthcare. This would be unthinkable without the undying exploits President Kim Il Sung performed by liberating Korea and wisely leading  the building of a new society, the Fatherland Liberation War, postwar rehabilitation and construction and socialist construction.

articles.title: British Bodies Denounce Japan's Moves to Revive Militarism
articles.content:
British Bodies Denounce Japan's Moves to Revive Militarism
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on August 20 made public a joint statement in support of the white paper of the Korean Jurists Committee. 
					 Expressing full support for the white paper disclosing the moves of the present Japanese authorities to revive militarism, the joint statement said:
					
					 Now many people of the world do not know well about the dangerous revival of Japanese militarism. 
					
					 The purpose of the retrogressive revision of the domestic laws pushed forward in Japan is to discard the mask of the "Pacifist Constitution" and realize overseas expansion and the revival of militarism. 
					
					 These moves are grave acts of disturbing the peace and security of the world and threatening the countries in the Asia-Pacific region which suffered from Japan's aggression in the last century, in particular. 
					
					 If the Japanese armed forces' overseas intervention is allowed, it may bring a big disaster to the world. 
					
					 Abe's administration's moves for revising the above-said laws are dangerous ones to realize the old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere". 
					
					 It is necessary to launch a worldwide movement against Japan's revival of militarism.

articles.title: Seminars Held Abroad to Mark Anniversary of Korea's Liberation
articles.content:
Seminars Held Abroad to Mark Anniversary of Korea's Liberation
Pyongyang, August 27 (KCNA) -- Seminars took place in Belgrade of Serbia, Helsinki of Finland, Stockholm of Sweden and Hannover of Germany from August 12 to 14 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation. 
					 Present at the seminars were personages from all walks of life and other masses in relevant countries. 
					
					 The chairman of the preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and Korea's liberation of the New Yugoslav Communist Party of Serbia said in his report:
					
					 Korea's liberation was, indeed, the precious fruition of the 20-year-long anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle led by President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 By liberating the country under the leadership of Comrade Kim Il Sung the Korean People's Revolutionary Army set a shining example in the anti-imperialist national liberation struggle. 
					
					 Juha Kieksy, international secretary of the Finnish Communists' League, and other speakers praised Kim Il Sung as the most prominent thinker and theoretician in the 20th century and the great leader of the world revolution as he always paid deep attention to the struggle of the progressive people for independence, indicated correct guidelines and ways for struggle on the basis of the Juche idea and rendered material and moral assistance to them. 
					
					 Oskar Molleby, chief of the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that the Korean people are now bravely meeting all the challenges of the imperialists and their followers and working hard to build a thriving nation, firmly adhering to the socialist principle and anti-imperialist independent stand under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The chief of the Hannover Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Germany said that just talking does not work on a robber coming in attack with a dagger and the only way out is to fight him with a sword. The DPRK was very just when it had access to nukes, he added. 
					
					 Congratulatory messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the seminars held in Finland and Sweden.

articles.title: Norte y Sur de Corea deben mejorar relaciones y tomar camino de reunificacion, insiste Kim Yang Gon
articles.content:
Norte y Sur de Corea deben mejorar relaciones y tomar camino de reunificacion, insiste Kim Yang Gon
Pyongyang, 27 de agosto (ACNC) -- A la pregunta formulada por la ACNC en relacion con el contacto urgente de alto nivel Norte-Sur de Corea, Kim Yang Gon, miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, dio el dia 27 una siguiente respuesta:
					Como esta conocido por todos, el Norte y el Sur de Corea sostuvieron del dia 22 al 24 en Phanmunjom el contacto urgente de alto nivel, ocasion en la cual hicieron publica la informacion conjunta tras discutir de manera comprensiva los problemas para arreglar la peligrosa situacion creada recientemente y mejorar las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					En el documento estan reflejadas la voluntad y la posicion de ambas partes de prevenir el conflicto armado y aliviar la tension entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea y promover el desarrollo de las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					Resulta muy afortunado el que a traves del presente contacto se elimino el peligro muy tirante que puede llevar la Peninsula Coreana y el resto del Noreste Asiatico al torbellino de la guerra y fue preparado el motivo de cambio dramatico para la paz, la estabilidad, la reconciliacion y la cooperacion entre ambas partes coreanas.
					
					Estoy complacido de que el Norte y el Sur de Corea, sentados cara a cara, lograron el acuerdo en las tareas comunes tras de simpatizar la gravedad de la situacion y consultarla con sinceridad abriendo asi la fase trascendental favorable a convertir lo malo en lo bueno en las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					Ahora, el interior y el exterior del pais envian aplausos unanimes al Norte y el Sur de Corea que previnieron el estado peligrosisimo dirigido al imprevisible conflicto y tomaron las manos de la reconciliacion.
					
					Al apreciar el espiritu del acuerdo alcanzado en el presente contacto, ambas partes coreanas no deben limitarse con la superacion de la extrema crisis, sino llevar adelante las relaciones N-S a la direccion constructiva hacia la reunificacion.
					
					Me parece que el contacto no podra tener la gran significacion si servia del encuentro para apagar el fuego emergente.
					
					Ambas partes deben eliminar la desconfianza y la confrontacion entre si y tomar con audaz el camino de mejorar las relaciones mediante los dialogos y las negociaciones. 
					
					Como acordaron en la informacion conjunta, el Norte y el Sur deben desarrollar el dialogo y las negociaciones entre las autoridades para solucionar los problemas de interes mutuo y dinamizar el intercambio y las cooperaciones en diversos dominios.
					
					Para este fin, es muy importante, antes que todo, mantener y controlar bien la actual corriente de la situacion con destino al alivio, preparada a duras penas por ambas partes.
					
					El Norte y el Sur de Corea deben esforzarse por prevenir los actos de empeorar la situacion y llevarla a la extremidad, envolviendose en el estado sacudido por el incidente incomprensible como el reciente caso.
					
					Francamente dicho, ambas partes coreanas no debian meterse en el estado anormal como el reciente.
					
					Las ambas partes deben sacar las lecciones del reciente caso y por mucho que se producen los problemas complejos entre el Norte y el Sur, no tienen que perder el juicio y control  y esforzarse juntos por prevenir tales situaciones.
					
					El Norte y el Sur no deben ser sometidos mas al pasado, sino tomar mano a mano el camino de la mejora de las relaciones y de la reunificacion pensando en el futuro de la nacion y viendo hacia adelante.
					
					Podrian existir las fuerzas opuestas al desarrollo vertiginoso de las relaciones intercoreanas y, por lo tanto debemos tratarlas con alta vigilancia.
					
					A partir de este punto de vista, el Norte y el Sur deben prestar primordial atencion a esforzarse por prevenir el caso imprevisto y mantener con firmeza el ideal de "Entre nosotros, los connacionales".
					
					Es invariable la posicion de la RPDC de abrir el ancho camino de la reunificacion independiente registrando los grandes cambios en las relaciones intercoreanas en el presente ano en que se cumple el 70o aniversario de la liberacion de la patria.
					
					Haremos activos esfuerzos por mejorar las relaciones N-S conforme a la aspiracion y el deseo de todos los coreanos basandose en el espiritu del acuerdo del reciente contacto urgente de alto nivel N-S.

articles.title: RPDC premia a jovenes y funcionarios ejemplares
articles.content:
RPDC premia a jovenes y funcionarios ejemplares
Pyongyang, 27 de agosto (ACNC) -- En la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hubo la premiacion estatal a los funcionarios, los brigadistas y los vanguardias jovenes en conductas loables, quienes realizaron meritos laborales en la reconstruccion y la reparacion de la ferrovia septentrional del pais.
					Las ceremonias de premiacion tuvieron lugar en distintos lugares.
					
					Segun los decretos del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, leidos en las ocasiones, el reloj con el nombre del Presidente Kim Il Sung fue otorgado a Rim Thae Sim y el diploma de honor del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, a Kim Song Nam, Cha Myong Chol, Jong Song Bok, Pak Song Hun, Ri Sun Chol y Kim Chol Su.
					
					El Premio de Honor Juvenil Kim Il Sung lo recibieron Ri Kum Chol, Kim Yong Nam, Kim Sun Il, Jo Hyok Chol, Kim Chang Ho, Kim Jun Chol, An Kyong Hui, Kim Kyong Ae, Kwon Sun Nam, O Hye Sim, Ri Jong Chol, Kim Kye Sung y Choe Yong Sim y el Premio de Honor Juvenil Kim Jong Il, Choe Song Gon, Han Ung, Jon Song Chol, Ri Hyon Min, Kim Song Hyon, Kim Su Jong, Ju Chun Song, Song Yun Hui, Han Hyon Ok, Ri Un Byol, Ri Kyong Sim, Kim Kwang Il y O Chol Jin.
					
					Fue otorgada la Orden Bandera Nacional de primera clase a 10 personas, la Orden del Trabajo a 3, la Orden Bandera Nacional de segunda clase, a 166, la Orden Bandera Nacional de tercera clase, a 362 y la Medalla del Merito Laboral a 786.
					
					Y la Medalla de Honor de Servicio de la Brigada de Choque Juvenil Batalla de Velocidad fue entregada a 3 mil 284 jefes y miembros de la Brigada de Choque Juvenil Batalla de Velocidad y la Brigada Juvenil 28 de Agosto.

articles.title: Cientificos de RPDC logran exitos en desarrollo de robot de uso industrial
articles.content:
Cientificos de RPDC logran exitos en desarrollo de robot de uso industrial
Pyongyang, 27 de agosto (ACNC) -- Los cientificos del instituto de maquinas de control de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias de Corea obtuvieron exitos de inventar e introducir los robots de uso industrial aplicados con las ciencias y tecnicas sofisticadas.
					El jefe de seccion Kim Song Chon dijo que el desarrollo de estos robots se presenta como demanda practica en varios sectores de la economia nacional, y prosiguio:
					
					Particularmente, el robot es indispensable en aumentar la productividad, reducir el precio de costo y mejorar el ambiente en el trabajo nocivo y dificil y los dominios que necesitan muchas manos de obra.
					
					Hemos logrado que los robots cumplan perfectamente todos los movimientos tales como el ciclo de operacion y la recogida y traslado de los productos conforme a la demanda de la ingenieria robotica en desarrollo continuo.
					
					Definimos la racional composicion cinematica y el proyecto de las estructuras de los nudos, y elaboramos el diseno del sistema mecanico basandose en el analisis y simulacion de la seguridad de vibracion.
					
					Ademas, establecimos el sistema de control y acareamiento del aparato CNC.
					
					Nuevos robots aplicados en la realidad aumentaron en 2 veces la productividad en comparacion con el tiempo anterior ahorrando muchas manos de obra en el proceso de traslado de las mercancias.

articles.title: Simposio Academico Internacional de Universidad Kim Il Sung-2015
articles.content:
Simposio Academico Internacional de Universidad Kim Il Sung-2015
Pyongyang, 27 de agosto (ACNC) -- El simposio academico internacional de la Universidad Kim Il Sung-2015, que tuvo lugar los dias 25 y 26, fue un conclave significativo en profundizar los lazos de amistad entre las universidades de varios paises del mundo.
					A traves del seminario celebrado bajo el tema del "Desarrollo cientifico y construccion de nacion civilizada", los participantes informaron los sobresalientes exitos de investigacion logrados en ramas de matematica, medicina, agronomia y la ciencia de vida e intercambiaron sus criterios. Ademas adquirieron valiosas experiencias para llevar al nivel alto el estudio sobre esas ramas.
					
					Y prepararon la base para promover activamente en lo adelante las actividades de intercambio academico entre las universidades y los cientificos de varios paises.
					
					Thae Hyong Chol, rector de la Universidad Kim Il Sung y ministro de Educacion Superior de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dijo que el seminario constituye el apoyo y estimulo a su universidad, y prosiguio:
					
					El estrecho intercambio y cooperacion con los sabios de las universidades de varios paises que tienen muchos exitos de investigacion en las ramas citadas traeran el fruto provechoso de convertir a los paises en los civilizados mas desarrollados.
					
					El vicerrector Ri Kuk Chol senalo que en este certamen fueron presentadas muchas disertaciones de valor academico y espero que las universidades de varios paises sigan estrechando activamente el intercambio y la cooperacion con la Universidad Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun critica la visita colectiva de politiqueros japoneses al santuario Yasukuni
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun critica la visita colectiva de politiqueros japoneses al santuario Yasukuni
Pyongyang, 27 de agosto (ACNC) -- El pasado dia 15, los politiqueros de Japon visitaron colectivamente al santuario Yasukuni.
					La visita al citado santuario no el asunto interior del Japon sino un problema politicamente agudo que demuestra la posicion y la actitud del gobierno japones acerca de la historia pasada de agresion, su liquidacion y la concepcion futura sobre Asia.
					
					Asi insiste Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual divulgado el dia 27 y continua:
					
					Es muy natural el que la sociedad internacional exprese la fuerte indignacion a la visita al santuario Yasukuni de los politiqueros japoneses y les exige abandonarla.
					
					Pero, la actitud de la capa gobernadora japonesa consterna a todo el mundo.
					
					Los politiqueros islenos enloquecidos en el militarismo tienen la posicion, segun la cual no necesitan escudrinar la actitud de otro, ni toma en consideracion el sentimiento de alguien en el problema de visitar el santuario en cuestion.
					
					Lo comprueba que cada ano el premier japones envia al santuario los gastos de ofrenda y el ministro de Asuntos Generales, el presidente de la Seguridad Publica de Estado y otros de alto rango realizan la visita habitual al lugar.
					
					El objeto de los politiqueros que recurren tesoneramente a esa actividad reside en armar a sus habitantes con la idea de agresion y realizar a toda costa la ambicion de reagresion.
					
					La reagresion deviene el acto de suicida de Japon.
					
					Como el Japon fascista, que ayer actuaba freneticamente por guerra de agresion con el sueno de ser "dueno del Oriente", probo el amargo sabor de la derrota, no podra cambiarse jamas el futuro de Japon que corre hacia la militarizacion revitalizando el "espiritu de Yamato".
